cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 16.6mm per hour during the storm today (ranking 2nd from our records) and resulted in 5.69mm of total rain in 3.2 hours.  27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.
A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 4th for length since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 10 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (192°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.35 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.9°C) and outside temperature (down 2.3°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.0 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.3 mm), cloud levels (up 1363 m), feels like temperature (up 3.8°C), and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 114.9m higher than yesterday, 256.0m lower than the past week, 1363.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 1225.4m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1481.4m and 2590m.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, pleasant humidity levels and little or no wind. Light to moderate rain is forecast, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and sunlight will be very intense and bright. Weather could become unsettled.
